thread.title: Manchester United captain Wayne Rooney's agent travels to China - source
thread.title_full: Manchester United captain Wayne Rooney's agent travels to China - source - ESPN FC

author: espn
title: Manchester United captain Wayne Rooney's agent travels to China - source
text:
Shaka Hislop breaks down the latest transfer rumours, including Wayne Rooney's potential move to the Chinese Super League. Mark Ogden discusses whether now would be the right time for Wayne Rooney to leave Manchester United. Jose Mourinho coyly answers questions on Wayne Rooney's future with Man United, but says he wants him to remain at the club. Wayne Rooney's agent has travelled to China amid reports he is trying to negotiate a transfer for the Manchester United captain.
The Sun and the BBC reported on Thursday that agent Paul Stretford had flown out in the hope of finding a buyer for Rooney, 31, either before the Chinese transfer deadline on Feb. 28 or in the summer.
A source confirmed to ESPN FC on Thursday morning that Stretford had left Manchester and travelled to China, although no reason was given for his visit. Stretford has an office in Beijing as part of his company Red Lantern.
Sources had told ESPN FC on Wednesday that Rooney wants to stay at United until the end of the season and help the club pursue silverware on three fronts before considering a move to the Chinese Super League or Major League Soccer.
Chinese Super League clubs are allowed only five foreign players on the books , with one of the five having to belong to a country from within the Asian Football Confederation, and just three may play in any one game .
Two top-flight clubs -- Jiangsu Suning and Beijing Guoan -- currently have an available space for an overseas player, but Jiangsu boss Fabio Cannavaro has said his club does not plan to pursue a deal for Rooney , while the BBC reported that Beijing are not interested.
Follow @ESPNFC on Twitter to keep up with the latest football updates.
